answerText: The Sound of the Mountain [or Yama no Oto] [10] The Sound of the Mountain was written by this Japanese author, who also penned Thousand Cranes, The House of the Sleeping Beauties, and The Master of Go.
heading: ACF Winter |2009 | UC Los Angeles B and Iowa | 8 | Literature | World | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: The protagonist spends time lusting after his secretary Eiko, his dead sister-in-law, and his son's wife Kikuko.   [10] Identify this 1952 novel about Ogata Shingo, who is the only one who can hear the title landform.
